dublin_core.dcvalue: A widespread use of mobile phones evokes a growing concern for their possible adverse effects on the human central nervous system This study was aimed at evaluating the effects of EMF generated by mobile phones at all standard wavelengths 450 935 and 1800 MHz used in Poland on the auditory brainstem evoked responses ABR during and after the exposure
International journal of occupational medicine and environmental health
No effects of acute exposure to the electromagnetic field emitted by mobile phones on brainstem auditory potentials in young volunteers.
